answer_html: \(\frac{d T}{dt}=-10.\) Therefore, the bee is experiencing a change in temperature of -10 temperature units per second at t = 2.
answer_latex:
$\frac{d T}{dt}=-10.$  Therefore, the bee is experiencing a change in temperature
of -10 temperature units per second at t = 2.
hints_html:
The rate of change of the temperature is the derivative of the temperature, which is the partial derivative of the temperature plus the directional derivative of \(\displaystyle T\) in the direction of the velocity vector v of the bee,

\(\frac{d T}{dt} = \frac{\partial T}{\partial t} + \nabla T \cdot \mathbf{v}\)

The vector v for the time \(t=2\) is already determined in part (a).

The rate of change of the temperature is the derivative of the
temperature, which is the partial derivative of the temperature plus the
directional derivative of $\displaystyle T$ in the direction of the
velocity vector v of the bee,

$\frac{d T}{dt} = \frac{\partial T}{\partial t} + \nabla T \cdot \mathbf{v}$

The vector v for the time $t=2$ is already determined in
{part
(a)}.
hints_raw:
The rate of change of the temperature is the derivative of the temperature, which is the partial derivative of the temperature plus the directional derivative of <math>\displaystyle T</math> in the direction of the velocity vector <b>v</b> of the bee,

<math>
\frac{d T}{dt} = \frac{\partial T}{\partial t} + \nabla T \cdot \mathbf{v}
</math>


The vector <b>v</b> for the time <math> t=2</math> is already determined in [[Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH200/December_2011/Question_03_(a)|part (a)]].
question: 3 (b)
sols_html:
To evaluate the change in temperature, \(T\), experienced by the bee with respect to time at time 2, we need to evaluate the full derivative of \(\displaystyle T = T(x(t),y(t),z(t),t)\) with respect to \(t\) and substitute in the value \(t = 2\). Writing the expression for the full time derivative gives:

\[\begin{aligned} \frac{d T}{dt} &= \frac{\partial T}{\partial t} + \frac{\partial T}{\partial x}\frac{dx}{dt} + \frac{\partial T}{\partial y}\frac{dy}{dt} + \frac{\partial T}{\partial z}\frac{dz}{dt} \\ &= \frac{\partial T}{\partial t} + \nabla T \cdot \mathbf{v}\end{aligned}\]

where \(\mathbf{v}\) is the velocity vector of the bee. Evaluating the terms in the above equation we find:

\[\begin{aligned} \frac{\partial T}{\partial t} = 2y, \quad \nabla T = \left[y - 3, x + 2t, 1\right]^{T}.\end{aligned}\]

Note that we don’t need to re-evaluate \(\mathbf{v}\) since we can just use our results from part (a) here. At time \(t = 2\), the bee is at \([1,1,0]\), so the above terms satisfy,

\[\begin{aligned} \frac{\partial T}{\partial t} = 2, \quad \nabla T = \left[-2, 5, 1\right]^{T}\end{aligned}\]

at \(t = 2\). Using this and the fact that \(\mathbf{v}\) \(= [-2,-4,4]\), we evaluate the change in temperature:

\[\begin{aligned} \frac{d T}{dt} &= 2 + [-2,5,1]^{T} \cdot [-2,-4,4]^{T} = 2+4-20+4 = -10.\end{aligned}\]

Therefore, the bee is experiencing a change in temperature of -10 temperature units per second at t = 2.
sols_latex:
To evaluate the change in temperature, $T$, experienced by the bee with
respect to time at time 2, we need to evaluate the full derivative of
$\displaystyle T = T(x(t),y(t),z(t),t)$ with respect to $t$ and
substitute in the value $t = 2$. Writing the expression for the full
time derivative gives:

\begin{align*}
\frac{d T}{dt} &= \frac{\partial T}{\partial t} + \frac{\partial T}{\partial x}\frac{dx}{dt} + \frac{\partial T}{\partial y}\frac{dy}{dt} + \frac{\partial T}{\partial z}\frac{dz}{dt} \\
&= \frac{\partial T}{\partial t} + \nabla T \cdot \mathbf{v}
\end{align*} where $\mathbf{v}$ is the velocity vector of the bee.
Evaluating the terms in the above equation we find:

\begin{align*}
\frac{\partial T}{\partial t} = 2y, \quad \nabla T = \left[y - 3, x + 2t, 1\right]^{T}.
\end{align*}
Note that we don't need to re-evaluate $\mathbf{v}$ since we can just
use our results from
{part
(a)} here. At time $t = 2$, the bee is at $[1,1,0]$, so the above terms
satisfy,

\begin{align*}
\frac{\partial T}{\partial t} = 2, \quad \nabla T = \left[-2,  5, 1\right]^{T}
\end{align*}
at $t = 2$. Using this and the fact that $\mathbf{v}$ $= [-2,-4,4]$, we
evaluate the change in temperature:

\begin{align*}
\frac{d T}{dt} &= 2 + [-2,5,1]^{T} \cdot [-2,-4,4]^{T} = 2+4-20+4 = -10.
\end{align*} Therefore, the bee is experiencing a change in temperature
of -10 temperature units per second at t = 2.
sols_raw:
To evaluate the change in temperature, <math>T</math>, experienced by the bee with respect to time at time 2, we need to evaluate the <b>full</b> derivative of <math>\displaystyle T = T(x(t),y(t),z(t),t)</math> with respect to <math>t</math> and substitute in the value <math>t = 2</math>. Writing the expression for the full time derivative gives:
:<math>
\begin{align}
\frac{d T}{dt} &= \frac{\partial T}{\partial t} + \frac{\partial T}{\partial x}\frac{dx}{dt} + \frac{\partial T}{\partial y}\frac{dy}{dt} + \frac{\partial T}{\partial z}\frac{dz}{dt} \\
&= \frac{\partial T}{\partial t} + \nabla T \cdot \mathbf{v}
\end{align}
</math>
where <math>\mathbf{v}</math> is the velocity vector of the bee. Evaluating the terms in the above equation we find:
:<math>
\frac{\partial T}{\partial t} = 2y, \quad \nabla T = \left[y - 3, x + 2t, 1\right]^{T}.
</math>
Note that we don't need to re-evaluate <math>\mathbf{v}</math> since we can just use our results from [[Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH200/December_2011/Question_03_(a)|part (a)]] here. At time <math>t = 2</math>, the bee is at <math>[1,1,0]</math>, so the above terms satisfy,
:<math>
\frac{\partial T}{\partial t} = 2, \quad \nabla T = \left[-2,  5, 1\right]^{T}
</math>
at <math>t = 2</math>. Using this and the fact that <math>\mathbf{v}</math> <math>= [-2,-4,4]</math>, we evaluate the change in temperature:
:<math>
\begin{align}
\frac{d T}{dt} &= 2 + [-2,5,1]^{T} \cdot [-2,-4,4]^{T} = 2+4-20+4 = -10.
\end{align}
</math>
<font color="blue">
Therefore, the bee is experiencing a change in temperature of -10 temperature units per second at <i>t = 2</i>.
</font>
statement_html:
A bee is flying along the curve of intersection of the surfaces \(3z + x^{2} + y^{2} = 2\) and \(z = x^{2} - y^{2}\) in the direction for which z is increasing. At time t = 2, the bee passes through the point (1,1,0) at speed 6.

(b) The temperature T at position (x,y,z) at time t is given by \(T = xy - 3x + 2yt + z\). Find the rate of change of temperature experienced by the bee at time \(t = 2\).

(b) The temperature T at position (x,y,z) at time t is given by
$T = xy - 3x + 2yt + z$. Find the rate of change of temperature
experienced by the bee at time $t = 2$.
statement_raw:
A bee is flying along the curve of intersection of the surfaces <math>3z + x^{2} + y^{2} = 2</math> and <math>z = x^{2} - y^{2} </math> in the direction for which z is increasing. At time t = 2, the bee passes through the point (1,1,0) at speed 6.

<b>(b)</b> The temperature T at position (x,y,z) at time t is given by <math>T = xy - 3x + 2yt + z</math>.
Find the rate of change of temperature experienced by the bee at time <math>t = 2</math>.
